text:
Hello Developers, 

We have a couple pieces of exciting news to share.

*First*, the CMS Boilerplate is now out of beta! The CMS Boilerplate is the fastest way to get starting building on the CMS. We are excited to share this progress and look forward to continue to iterate on it with your feedback to make it even better in the future.

Learn more here: <https://github.com/HubSpot/cms-theme-boilerplate>

*Second,* We will be opening the Asset Marketplace to start accepting Theme submissions on 3/10. Here at HubSpot, we believe Themes represent the future of how marketer-friendly websites will be designed on the HubSpot CMS. Developers who wish to build websites that delight content creators and use the latest HubSpot CMS features should start utilizing Themes.

See full announcement here: <http://bit.ly/2TmpUj3>

Build your next site as a theme and try to use drag-and-drop areas today! Can’t or don’t want to? Let us know why.

<@U26AKMZ19> the hope if groups are required was to have a specific font, text-transform, and font-styles all in the same group. Ideally, just having those connected to one font is ideal. It’s too much trouble creating separate groups for every font
<@U7SL518D6> thanks that does help. `fallback` is nice to have.
Yes - that definitely makes sense! Will definitely pass this feedback along.
